page.title: 09FARMING
page.content: The main type of farming in the area is{dairy farming.}Although from the farms studied in the block other types of farming were arable,cerial{ and pig farming. Most of the farms do not specialise in just the one type of farming. The farms varied in size from forty acres to 240 acres.The farm of forty acres was previously 80 acres prior to the building of the M.56. Some of the farms contained unusual features. E.g. Home Farm has old cock-fighting pens and a dovecote, Pool Bank farm has a motte & bailey Roman site called Watch Hill.One farm also had an ancient berial mound (see fairy brow). The farmers rely on either relatives working on the farm,full time labourers and seasonal labourers.
